xxl.io
Class Converter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.io.Converter
Direct Known Subclasses:
AsciiKPEConverter, BooleanArrayConverter, BooleanConverter, ByteArrayConverter, ByteConverter, CharacterArrayConverter, CharacterConverter, ConvertableConverter, DoubleArrayConverter, DoubleConverter, FloatArrayConverter, FloatConverter, IntegerArrayConverter, IntegerConverter, LongArrayConverter, LongConverter, ObjectArrayConverter, ORTree.IndexEntryConverter, ORTree.NodeConverter, SerializableConverter, ShortArrayConverter, ShortConverter, StringArrayConverter, StringBufferConverter, StringConverter, UniformConverter
public abstract class Converter
extends Object

The class Converter is used for serializing objects that cannot implement the Convertable interface (e.g., predefined classes of the SDK). Like the Convertable interface it prevents the two drawbacks of the SDK serialization mechanism:

  • it causes overhead by writing additional data like the identity of class to the output stream.
  • it does not accept raw data input streams because it expects the written additional data.

The write and read methods give an implementation of Converter complete control over the format and contents of the stream for an object and its supertypes. These methods must explicitly coordinate with the supertype to save its state.

See Also:
DataInput, DataOutput, IOException

Constructor Detail

Method Detail

read

public abstract Object read(DataInput dataInput,
                            Object object)
                     throws IOException
Reads the state (the attributes) for the specified object from the specified data input and returns the restored object. The state of the specified object before the call of read will be lost. When object == null a new object should be created and restored.
The read method must read the values in the same sequence and with the same types as were written by write.
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read data from in order to restore the object.
object - the object to be restored. When object == null a new object should be created and restored.
Returns:
the restored object.
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.

read

public Object read(DataInput dataInput)
            throws IOException
Creates a new object by reading the state (the attributes) from the specified data input and returns the restored object. The read method must read the values in the same sequence and with the same types as were written by write.
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read data from in order to restore the object.
Returns:
the restored object.
Throws:
IOException - if I/O errors occur.

write

public abstract void write(DataOutput dataOutput,
                           Object object)
                    throws IOException
Writes the state (the attributes) of the specified object to the specified data output. This method should serialize the state of this object without calling another write method in order to prevent recursions.
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the state (the attributes) of the object to.
object - the object whose state (attributes) should be written to the data output.
Throws:
IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
